chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: JMol is far more than just a Java based tool for displaying 3D chemical information.

section.para:
The program jmol has (at this moment) one command line option: -script. De current syntax is:
jmol -script rasmol.script
This makes it possible to start jmol with a Rasmol script. The syntax of these scripts is explained later in this documentation.

section.title: Open
section.para:
Open files in Jmol. Jmol can read files of the following types:
ACES II
ADF - Amsterdam Density Functional
GAMESS
Gaussian 92/94/98
XYZ (single and multiple frame)
PDB (ATOM and HETATM entries only)
CML

section.title: Export Image
section.para:
Jmol can export images of the following types:
GIF
JPG
PPM
Note that GIF pictures can only be exported if the displayed image is 8 bit.

section.title: Exit
section.para: Quits this Jmol session.

section.title: Recent Files...
section.para: Brings up a dialog with a list of the files the program has been asked to open recently. The file can be opened again by selecting it and clicking the ok button.

section.title: The Display menu
section.para: In this menu display settings can be changed.

section.title: Quick Draw
section.para: Views molecules without shading. Preferred on slower computers.

section.title: Shading
section.para: Views molecules with shading. Since this takes more calculations, this only works well on faster computers.

section.title: No Atom Labels
section.para: View the atoms without any label.

section.title: Atomic Symbols
section.para: Label the atoms with their symbol.

section.title: Atom Types
section.para: Label the atoms with their atom type.

section.title: Wire Frame Rotation
section.para: When manipulating large molecules, the renderer maybe rather slow. When this option is checked, the program uses a fast drawing mode when the molecule is being moved. When the mouse is released, the molecule is draw in the current style.

section.title: Bonds
section.para: If this option is checked it views bonds.

section.title: Atoms
section.para: If this option is checked it views atoms.

section.title: Vectors
section.para: If this option is checked it views vectors like dipole moments.

section.title: Graph...
section.para: This opens a window in which a energy versus frames plot is viewed. This option currently only works when reading a CML animation with energies given for each frame.
An example file is supplied: conformeren.cml.
